title.description: Names the specific work to which the entry refers

workDescription.description: Provides detailed information about a work

workId.description: A generated unique identifier for a work within the collection

version.description: A version of a work is different from other versions in its code and it thus provides a distinct experience

versionNumber.description: Identifies the specific version of a work

versionLetter.description: Modifies version number where needed in order to identify small differences between versions

publicationDay.description: Identifies the day within a month on which a version of a work was published

publicationMonth.description: Identifies the month in which a version of a work was published

publicationYear.description: Identifies the year in which a version of a work was published from 1950 to 2100

softwareDependencies.description: Identifies software platforms, programs, and standards required to access and experience the work. If the work is designed for a specific operating system such as Windows, macOS, or iOS, that should be specified here. For example, a work may require a web browser, a specific version of Adobe Flash, or a particular game engine.

hardwareDependencies.description: Identifies the kind of computing device and its onboard components required to access and experience the work. For example, a work may require a desktop computer with a graphics card or a mobile device with a touchscreen.

peripheralDependencies.description: Describes additional hardware not integral to the ordinary function of the original computing device

authoringPlatform.description: Describes the primary digital tool used in the production of a work

computerLanguages.description: Describes relevant programming languages used in the production of a work. For example, a work may be written in JavaScript, Python, or C++. If the language is unknown, the tool used to create the work may be specified instead such as Twine, Unity, or Processing.

genres.description: Describes the artistic genre(s) of a work

languages.description: Identifies the oral or written language(s) used in creation and/or translation of a work

contentTiming.description: Describes the speed of a work's content

textFormat.description: Describes how a work implements font families, font size, and effects

colorAndContrast.description: Attends to partial visual disability and color blindness

visualImpact.description: Describes visual elements that may startle, surprise, or be hazardous for visitors

auditory.description: Describes sounds produced by the work

touch.description: Describes how visitors interface with the work physically by making contact with screens, buttons, dials, etc.

hapticFeedback.description: Describes how the work registers meaningful physical feedback in a visitor's body

repetitiveMotion.description: Describes works that require repetitive physical input from visitors

movementAndGesture.description: The work registers the visitor's non-touch physical movements as input

artificialIntelligenceGeneratedContent.description: Indicates whether the work contains content generated by artificial intelligence systems, services, or agents

artificialIntelligenceGeneratedCode.description: Indicates whether the work contains code generated by artificial intelligence systems, services, or agents

artificialIntelligenceToolsUsed.description: Lists the artificial intelligence tools used in the creation of the work

artificialIntelligenceModelsUsed.description: Lists the artificial intelligence models and/or agents used in the creation of the work

artificialIntelligenceExternalLinks.description: Provides external URLs to the language models or services relevant to the work
